object.field:
Concatenates the value of the channel with the value of the strings given by the user. The user can give both a "Before" string and an "After" string to be concatenated before or after the value of the channel.
e.g. Channel value: 'aaa' Before (given by user): After (given by user): 'bbb' Returns: 'aaabbb'

Encodes the value of the channel as a valid component of a universal resource identifier (URI, Uniform Resource Identifier).
e.g. Channel value: 'ezweb platform' Returns: 'ezweb%20platform'

Takes the value of the channel as a universal resource identifier (URI, Uniform Resource Identifier) and returns its string version decoded.
e.g. Channel value: 'ezweb%20platform' Returns: 'ezweb platform'

Searchs for a specified value in the value of the channel using regular expressions. Return a JSON list with the occurrences. If no occurrence is found the value is NOT propagated. e.g. Looks up the characters before the first comma Channel value: 'Getafe, Madrid' Regular expresion (given by user): '/[\\w|\\s]*,/' Returns: ['Getafe,']

Searchs for a specific value in the value of the channel using regular expressions, and replaces it with the string given by the user. e.g. Replaces the brackets with an empty character (removes the bracket) Channel value: '(304)4345454' Regular expresion (given by user): '/[\(\)]/g' Returns: '3044345454'

Divides the value of the channel into substrings using the given separator, and creates an array containing the resulting substrings. The delimiter value is not returned as part of the array of substrings. If "How many" is given, it specifies how many times split should occur. Must be a numeric value.
e.g. Channel value: 'Internet' Delimiter (given by user): 'e' Returns: ["Int", "rn", "t"]

Extracts a specified number of characters from a string beginning at the specified start index.
e.g. Channel value: 'EzWeb' Start index (given by user): '2' Length (given by user): '3' Returns: 'Web'

Downcases all the letters of the value of the channel.
e.g. Channel value: 'EZWEB' Returns: 'ezweb'

Capitalizes all the letters of the value of the channel.
e.g. Channel value: 'ezweb' Returns: 'EZWEB'
Find elements in JSON structures. Visit this page for further information.

Propagates only when all the inputs have been modified. If all the inputs are available, this filter generates a JSON structure containing the name and the value of each input. That is, "{'name1':'value1', 'name2':'value2'}". Optionally, you can change the indexes of the structure by giving a string like this as a parameter: {'name1': 'new_index1','name2': 'new_index2'}
